author: Special Correspondent
text:
Senior Congress leader and Rajya Sabha MP Ahmed Patel has conveyed to Finance Minister Arun Jaitley his concern over withdrawal of customs duty exemption on 74 medicines.

The withdrawal of exemption came last week, following a notice by the Central Board of Excise and Customs. This will result in a rise in the prices of the drugs.

“This is an extremely worrisome decision and is in complete conflict with the larger public,” Mr. Patel said in a letter to the Finance Minister. “Why were these select medicines targeted and what were the prior consultations to arrive at this list?”

“Given that a vast number of these medicines come under the National Essential Medicines List, 2015, why has the government allowed their prices to rise,” Mr. Patel asked.

“Most of these medicines are the only link between life and death, especially for patients of cancer and haemophilia, many of them who live in underdeveloped tribal regions and need doses of anti-haemophilic factor concentrates on a regular basis,” he wrote.

Calling the government’s move “confounding” despite Prime Minister Narendra Modi opposing it last November, the letter stated that the changes in the duty would “impose an additional burden” on the patients who come from poor backgrounds.

“While I completely endorse the broader aim of boosting local production of medicines, this endeavour cannot be undertaken at the cost of compromising access to affordable healthcare in the present,” Mr. Patel said.
title: Worrisome move, says Congress
